newsitem.title: HONG KONG: China Res to buy 10 pct HIT for HK$3.5 bln.
newsitem.headline: China Res to buy 10 pct HIT for HK$3.5 bln.

text.p: China Resources Enterprise Ltd said on Wednesday it had agreed to buy a 10 percent stake of container terminal operator HIT Investments Ltd from its parent China Resources (Holdings) Co Ltd (CRH) for HK$3.5 billion.
The company will pay HK$2.25 billion in cash and issue 111.11 million new shares, or 7.63 percent of the enlarged share capital of the company, at HK$11.25 per share to CRH, it said in a statement.
CRH also agreed to place 90.90 million existing shares it held in China Resources Enterprise at HK$11.25 a share to private investors, the company said.
After the acquisition and placement CRH will own about 52.48 percent of the company compared to 52.08 percent currently, China Resources said.

The issue and placement price of the China Resources shares represented a discount of about 1.8 percent to the shares last traded price of HK$11.46 on Tuesday before trading was suspended for an announcement, it added.
The shares are expected to resume trading on Wednesday.
HIT, which is a 77.5 percent indirectly owned subsidiary of Hutchison Whampoa Ltd, provides container terminal services and the operation of container terminals in Hong Kong.
It also operates container terminals in Yantian, in China's Shenzhen.
The company said total dividends declared by HIT in respect of CRH's 10 percent interest in the group was HK$82.5 million and HK$120 million for calendar years 1994 and 1995, respectively.
